sense.name: Seize; take temporary possession of something.
sense.examples: The customs agents sequestered the illegal shipment. Police sequestered the artwork. The estate was sequestered by the bank.

sense.name: (Chemistry) Undergo sequestration by forming a stable compound with an ion.
sense.examples: The cations were sequestered by lab assistants. We sequester the cations first.

sense.name: Set apart from others.
sense.examples: He sequestered himself from the group. I've sequestered myself in my office. The dentist sequesters the tooth she is working on.
